articles.title: AirAsia settles over 90pc of passenger refunds so far, says Tony Fernandes - Malay Mail
articles.description: KUALA LUMPUR, March 28 — AirAsia had settled over 90 per cent of passenger refunds thus far, despite financial difficulty faced by the airline industry which was hit by the Covid-19 pandemic, and is not expected to face a big hurdle to settle more in a few mo…
articles.content: Capital A Bhd (formerly known as AirAsia Group Bhd) chief executive officer (CEO) Tan Sri Tony Fernandes said AirAsia Xs guests would also be getting vouchers when the airline started flying as a ges… [+3511 chars]

articles.title: Philippine Airlines parent resumes trading after bankruptcy exit - Nikkei Asia
articles.description: Flag carrier aims to take off with more cargo and digitized operations

articles.author: Alexander Wong
articles.title: Super Plus: AirAsia offers unlimited free flights within ASEAN and free food delivery for RM639 - SoyaCincau.com
articles.description: AirAsia has launched Super+, its one-year unlimited pass which offers unlimited free flights within ASEAN with covid coverage and free food delivery. Only 200,000 passes are up for grabs at RM639 each.
articles.content: Ahead of the reopening of Malaysia’s international borders, AirAsia has launched Super+, its new unlimited subscription service which offers unlimited flights with COVID-19 insurance coverage and fre… [+2905 chars]

articles.title: Ikhsan Fandi brace gives Lions win in front of record crowd; Malaysia coach finds it 'difficult to say' if Singapore deserves victory - AsiaOne
